bugs.title: CVE-2022-24836 rubygem-nokogiri: nokogiri: ReDoS in HTML encoding detection [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2022-24836 rubygem-nokogiri: nokogiri: ReDoS in HTML encoding detection [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2022-24836 nokogiri: ReDoS in HTML encoding detection

long_desc.thetext:
Nokogiri is an open source XML and HTML library for Ruby. Nokogiri `< v1.13.4` contains an inefficient regular expression that is susceptible to excessive backtracking when attempting to detect encoding in HTML documents. Users are advised to upgrade to Nokogiri `>= 1.13.4`. There are no known workarounds for this issue.

https://github.com/sparklemotion/nokogiri/security/advisories/GHSA-crjr-9rc5-ghw8
https://github.com/sparklemotion/nokogiri/commit/e444525ef1634b675cd1cf52d39f4320ef0aecfd

Created rubygem-nokogiri tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 2074347]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 2074348]

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Satellite 6.12 for RHEL 8

Via RHSA-2022:8506 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2022:8506

This bug is now closed. Further updates for individual products will be reflected on the CVE page(s):

https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2022-24836

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of fedora-all.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

When submitting as an update, use the fedpkg template provided in the next
comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as
the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

NOTE: this issue affects multiple supported versions of Fedora. While only
one tracking bug has been filed, please correct all affected versions at
the same time.  If you need to fix the versions independent of each other,
you may clone this bug as appropriate.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# low, medium, high, urgent (required)
severity=high

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=2074346,2074348

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new
FEDORA-2022-d231cb5e1f has been submitted as an update to Fedora 36. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2022-d231cb5e1f
FEDORA-2022-9ed7641ce0 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 35. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2022-9ed7641ce0
FEDORA-2022-132c6d7c2e has been submitted as an update to Fedora 34. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2022-132c6d7c2e

FEDORA-2022-9ed7641ce0 has been pushed to the Fedora 35 testing repository.
Soon you'll be able to install the update with the following command:
`sudo dnf upgrade --enablerepo=updates-testing --advisory=FEDORA-2022-9ed7641ce0`
You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2022-9ed7641ce0

See also https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for more information on how to test updates.

Soon you'll be able to install the update with the following command:

You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2022-132c6d7c2e

See also https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for more information on how to test updates.

FEDORA-2022-d231cb5e1f has been pushed to the Fedora 36 testing repository.
Soon you'll be able to install the update with the following command:
`sudo dnf upgrade --enablerepo=updates-testing --advisory=FEDORA-2022-d231cb5e1f`
You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2022-d231cb5e1f

See also https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for more information on how to test updates.

FEDORA-2022-132c6d7c2e has been pushed to the Fedora 34 stable repository.
If problem still persists, please make note of it in this bug report.

FEDORA-2022-9ed7641ce0 has been pushed to the Fedora 35 stable repository.
If problem still persists, please make note of it in this bug report.
Closing as fixes for stable branches are aleady pushed. (For f37, currently push is frozen, but will be pushed before f37 formal release)

If problem still persists, please make note of it in this bug report.

comments.text: This update has been submitted for testing by mtasaka.
This update's test gating status has been changed to 'ignored'.
This update has been pushed to testing.
This update has been submitted for stable by bodhi.
This update has been pushed to stable.

notes: New version 1.13.4 is released. This new version addresses possible DOS by regex, assigned as CVE-2022-24836.
title: rubygem-nokogiri-1.13.4-1.fc36
